title: Yuying Lu
text:
CV 






I am a second-year PhD student in Biostatistics at Columbia University, advised by Dr. Tian Gu.
Prior to joining Columbia, I received my Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics and Applied Mathematics at Shanghai Jiao Tong University, advised by Dr. Lin Liu.
My research interests lie at the intersection of Knowledge Transfer, Adaptive Data Fusion, and , with particular application to high-dimensional biological data and Electronic Health Records (EHR). I’m currentlt Data Generation
Please feel free to reach out via email for collaboration!

title: Yuying Lu

Prior to joining Columbia, I received my Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics and Applied Mathematics at Shanghai Jiao Tong University, advised by Dr. Lin Liu.

title: Yuying Lu
text:
Research Interests
I focus on developing robust statistical learning and machine learning technique to enhance model generalizability to support precise and accurate diagnostics, individualized treatments, and improve patient outcomes. Currently, I am working on:

Transfer Learning: Methods for observational studies.
Generative Models: Applications of diffusion models in EHR data.
Optimization: Theory behind non-convex optimization in deep learning.
